dt: {bc}to imitate or feign especially with intent to deceive
{bc}to try to deceive by pretense or dissembling

pt: {sc}assume{/sc} {sc}affect{/sc} {sc}pretend{/sc} {sc}simulate{/sc} {sc}feign{/sc} {sc}counterfeit{/sc} {sc}sham{/sc} mean to put on a false or deceptive appearance. {sc}assume{/sc} often implies a justifiable motive rather than an intent to deceive.

pt.t: {it}assumed{/it} an air of cheerfulness around the patients

pt: {sc}affect{/sc} implies making a false show of possessing, using, or feeling.
{sc}pretend{/sc} implies an overt and sustained false appearance.
{sc}simulate{/sc} suggests a close imitation of the appearance of something.
{sc}feign{/sc} implies more artful invention than {sc}pretend{/sc}, less specific mimicry than {sc}simulate{/sc}.
{sc}counterfeit{/sc} implies achieving the highest degree of verisimilitude of any of these words.
{sc}sham{/sc} implies an obvious falseness that fools only the gullible.

shortdef: to imitate or feign especially with intent to deceive; also : to make a fraudulent replica of
to try to deceive by pretense or dissembling
to engage in counterfeiting something of value

dt.t: The $20 bill turned out to be a {wi}counterfeit{/wi}.

dt: {bc}something likely to be mistaken for something of higher value

pt: {sc}imposture{/sc} {sc}fraud{/sc} {sc}sham{/sc} {sc}fake{/sc} {sc}humbug{/sc} {sc}counterfeit{/sc} mean a thing made to seem other than it is. {sc}imposture{/sc} applies to any situation in which a spurious object or performance is passed off as genuine.

pt.t: their claim of environmental concern is an {it}imposture{/it}

pt: {sc}fraud{/sc} usually implies a deliberate perversion of the truth.

pt.t: the diary was exposed as a {it}fraud{/it}

pt: {sc}sham{/sc} applies to fraudulent imitation of a real thing or action.
{sc}fake{/sc} implies an imitation of or substitution for the genuine but does not necessarily imply dishonesty.

pt.t: these jewels are {it}fakes{/it}; the real ones are in the vault

pt: {sc}humbug{/sc} suggests elaborate pretense usually so flagrant as to be transparent.

pt.t: creating publicity by foisting {it}humbugs{/it} on a gullible public

pt: {sc}counterfeit{/sc} applies especially to the close imitation of something valuable.

shortdef: something likely to be mistaken for something of higher value
